principles.outputFirst: Every artefact must be board-ready without hand-finishing.
principles.idempotentRuns: Re-running phases must not duplicate or drift.
principles.complianceGate: Quentin’s pass (AU default) is non-negotiable before export.

categoryTruthsChecklist: State 3–5 non-generic truths supported by shopper behaviour.
Name 2–3 audience tensions in the buyer’s words.
Call the brand’s unfair advantage in one sentence.
List hard constraints: legal, retailer, budget, ops, timing.

mechanicHeuristics: If collection → show progress and near-miss nudges.
If instant-win → ensure believable win cadence + social proof.
If partner mash-up → the partner must unlock a new behaviour, not just discounts.
Always include a habit-forming loop (cue → action → reward → variable reward).
hookRules: One-sentence consumer promise; no internal jargon.
Show the prize ladder logic (lots of small wins, few hero wins).
channelDefaults: Own app/web first; retailer app tiles; POS where feasible; email/SMS cadence tied to mechanic moments.

pressureTestGrid.works: What is provably strong given constraints?

retailerFitExamples: Coles: Flybuys leverage, clean POS, measurable uplift.
Woolworths: Everyday Rewards tie-in, family-safe UGC.
IGA: community angle, local legend assets, simpler ops.

narrativeBones: Open with the problem in the buyer’s language.
Name Bruce’s Choice (one route) and why it wins.
Show Route Tiles (name, hook, how it works, value exchange).
Next 10 days: owners, milestones, decision gates.

ask.questionStyle: Polite, surgical, one fact per question, explain why we ask.

alcohol: ABAC: no minors, no depict unsafe/rapid consumption, placement rules.
Age gating on all digital touchpoints.
State permits for trade promotion lotteries where required.
general: Clear T&Cs, prize source of truth, draw and notification procedures.
UGC moderation, profanity filters, take-down process.

spectacularness: Distinctive Aussie wink or local legend leverage when appropriate.
Reciprocal value exchange (customer gives data/behaviour, gets real utility).
Iconic partner or asset used for a *behavioural* reason, not badge value.
